alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Massac; Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:34PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski, northwestern Massac and southwestern Johnson Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 834 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Karnak, or 11 miles southwest of Vienna, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Karnak around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Columbia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 24 and 25. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 18 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
